meanings.definition: The production of only one type of spore by an individual plant or plant structure.
meanings.sent1: Homospory is when a plant makes just one kind of spore.
meanings.sent2: The homospory of the fern ensures uniform spore production.
meanings.sent3: The homospory of the cactus led to a spore party with only one type invited.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of homospory, diversity was replaced by uniformity.
meanings.sent5: The concept of homospory simplifies spore production for plants.

meanings.sent1: Homospory refers to the state of being homosporous.
meanings.sent2: The homospory of the moss indicates its homosporous nature.
meanings.sent3: At the homospory convention, all attendees shared the same spore type.
meanings.sent4: The homospory of the lake reflected a serene and undisturbed environment.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of homospory lies in its simplicity and consistency.
